item.title: Getting started
item.description:
Quickstart

In this tutorial, you will discover Microcks mocking features by re-using a simple REST API sample. For that: you will run Microcks on your local machine, then load a sample provided by the Microcks team, explore the web user interface and then interact with an API mock.

item.title: Getting started with Tests
item.description:
Quickstart (continue) with Tests

Now that you have finished the Getting started guide, you should have a Microcks installation up-and-running and filled with some samples from the Microcks repository. The goal of this page is to show you how you can use Microcks to achieve Contract Testing for your API, either manually from the UI or in an automated way using the Microcks CLI tooling.

item.title: Your 1st REST mock
item.description:
Overview

This tutorial is a step-by-step walkthrough on how to use OpenAPI v3 Specification to specify your mocks for your API. This is hands-on introduction to OpenAPI Conventions reference that brings all details on conventions being used.
